website_summaries.verdict: Columbia’s Bugaboot III seems to excel in comfort and warmth—two characteristics that enable outdoor enthusiasts to enjoy cold, winter hikes. Its robust build did not ask for a lengthy break-in period, earning more compliments.However, a couple of reported mishaps tarnished its almost perfect performance. All in all, these minor issues are subdued by the advantages of the Columbia Bugaboot III snow boot.
pros: Most online shoppers say that the Columbia Bugaboot III is a comfortable pair of winter hiking boots
Its minimal break-in period earns the approval of a lot of owners
According to some wearers, the Bugaboot III keeps their foot cozy even in very low temperatures
Its waterproofing proves to be effective against wet encounters, based on plenty of consumer reviews
The majority praise the lightness of the Bugaboot III from Columbia
Several long-time wearers of the Columbia Bugaboot III attest to its durability
cons: An avid hiker is a tad frustrated with the closure system
He wished that the top eyelet was a hook instead of a loop for ease of use with gloves

customer_reviews.title: Order big
customer_reviews.text: Because I purchased their regular hiking shoes, I thought these boots would be high quality. They simply do not last if you use them to hike in wet terrain. A terrible purchase. I wear 11 and these came too small.
customer_reviews.author: Alan S. Mathias

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality
customer_reviews.text: A Little on the small size for fit ! Get wide width and take out the in sole its to thick get a more compact wool one! But Very Good Quality Boot and Very Warm Should make this a good winter for my feet anyway !!
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Liapis

customer_reviews.title: Ridiculously Too Small
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to see that Columbia started offering wide boots again, especially in the Bugaboot series. The old version of this boot took me through the swamps of Virginia and the muddier mountains of NC. But even ordering a 1/2 size up on the Men's Columbia Bugaboot, this boot was impossible to get onto my slightly wider foot, and as soon as I got it onto my left foot, I winced at how tight it was. Tried to take the insole out and noticed that someone had already done the same thing, along with a slight scuff on the boot, I guess I wasn't the only person to return these.
customer_reviews.author: TheOrdinaryHiker

customer_reviews.title: Great boots
customer_reviews.text: Superb quality,very comfortable, totally waterproof. All around great boots. I wear 10 1/2 and ordered 11 and they fit perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: mca

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I went a half size up. Fits great. Used these in 12+ inches of snow for a 2 mile walk. Kept my feet warm and dry. Great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Rh

customer_reviews.title: Runs small ! very warm
customer_reviews.text: Runs really small my sons a size 10 ordered a size 10 then a size 10 1/2 then finally the 11 size fit ! Very warm boot !:)
customer_reviews.author: Rosangelina P Lebron

customer_reviews.title: Nice feeling boot
customer_reviews.text: I bought this out of season to get a better price and took a chance on ordering a 1/2 size larger then normal because of many reviews stating that these run small. Happy to say it was the right choice and they seem to fit nice at the larger size. They have some pretty significant interior padding, I assume to help with warmth factor, so i'm sure this is contributing to the "tight feeling" that many people run across. I haven't had a chance to really break them in yet, but they seem like a solid boot and I'm looking forward to giving them the proper test next winter.
customer_reviews.author: T. Leaf

customer_reviews.title: BREAK THEM IN AND THEY'LL FIT.....
customer_reviews.text: I've seen a lot of unhappy reviews on here, so I figured maybe this will help. Yes.... I ordered half a size up, and they WERE snug..... at first. I wore them around the block of my neighborhood to "open them up", or "break them in", and a mile and a half later they're all good. I expect this from brand new boots or shoes, though. At 40 years of age I guess I'm experienced enough to know about the break in period, and what to do to break shoes or boots in. Give it time, people. Ya'll are in too big of a hurry......
customer_reviews.author: Daniel T. SWan

customer_reviews.title: Size not as expected
customer_reviews.text: The ankle on this boot is very high, and VERY stiff. I tried for 10 minutes to cram my feet into these, and finally gave up. From the amount of foot I was able to get in, they also seem to run small; this does not feel like a 'wide' boot.
customer_reviews.author: lizardlord

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality Boot....And Very Warm!
customer_reviews.text: I love these boots. Please note my summary below... Pros: -Good quality boot at great price -Very comfortable -Super warm Cons: -Did I mention they were warm? Maybe, too warm for what you need. See below: Summary: -These boots are great. I used them last winter, for shoveling snow down to zero degrees. My feet were warm and dry the whole time. IF, you are looking for a mid-range temperature boot--say ~30 degrees--I'm not sure these would be for you. Your feet might sweat. I don't wear them unless it is pretty cold. It is not the boot's fault they are warm. Take that for what you will.
customer_reviews.author: Rock O Ages

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Boot
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy with this boot. I ordered a 1/2 size larger and a wide. These fit great right out of the box. They are comfortable and warm. Everything I wanted. As others have mentioned, the laces are too short but that's not a deal breaker. I had trouble finding a wide boot and these work great with thick socks. There's no leather on them so you won't need additional conditioning or waterproofing.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Costello

customer_reviews.title: Exquisite boots
customer_reviews.text: This is the most comfortable pair of boots I ever owned. The cushining is superb and they are very well made . I usually wear size 15 but I ordered size 16 to wear heavy socks. I am glad I did because they fit me perfectly. A 15 would’ve been snug. They also look very sharp. Good Job Columbia.
customer_reviews.author: A Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and snug
customer_reviews.text: These are comfortable and snug. The bottom flexes almost like sneakers, almost. The top don't dig into my shin like stiffer boots. My feet are narrow so if you have wide feet, even a high arch, or fat toes then I would highly recommend a wide size, because they are snug on top of my toes. My toes don't touch the front, but I think the filling in the boots, needs breaking in and that's why it's snug. Overall for me they are comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Megatron Amazon

customer_reviews.title: Wanted to give it 5⭐ But...........
customer_reviews.text: Would've loved to give five ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐ but.........the only issue I've had so far is that I wear a size 12 in any other type of foot wear basically. These I read run small from other reviews. And YES they DO RUN SMALL IN SIZE. I RECOMMEND AT LEAST 2 SIZES BIGGER !!! YES I SAID 2. I ordered 1 size bigger a 13. They were still a little snug not really complaining because they fit I'm not having feet issues like soreness or anything. It's just I feel if I wanted to wear thicker maybe insulated socks it would be tough.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Nice Boot.
customer_reviews.text: I did follow other reviews and order up a bit. Sizes vary so much for me with different manufacturers and types. I almost always need a wide but have footwear ranging from 11.5 to 13W. These boots fit great including room for a thick sock = so for me, they run fairly close to what I'd expect. Comfortable. Well made. Waterproof for sure. Walking the dog at night through slushy snow is a breeze. Only they don't get a minus 25 degree rating from me. They are warm enough and comfortable but after being outside in the snow for an hour - my feet are a little cold.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Size difference
customer_reviews.text: I bought the size 13 and they fit perfectly. I wear a 12 in Merrill and Timberline boots, a 12 1/2 in Nike and Adidas running shoes. Size chart said US 13=Eur 46 and it’s correct. If you’re big from the calf down, or have limited ankle flexibility, you may have issues. The boot tongue is sewn in high up the boot shaft (like any good waterproof boot), so you need to point your toe down, similar to entering a ski boot, to get in. I’d call this an urban pac boot. Shallow tread, but it removes snow efficiently to prevent build up while in use. Light, comfortable boot for shoveling and apre’ ski
customer_reviews.author: justjoe

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for under $100
customer_reviews.text: English translation from French (Canada). The boots are really good. They are well designed and have good rubber studs. I wear this size and they make me comfortable. They do not seem so hot as the so-called label of minus 25 degrees F. I have already been using shoveling and working outside in slightly cold weather -10 degree F. 200g of insulation seems good for the size and the space of my feet in the boots. Very firm at the ankle. That's why the whole thing, that I recommend these boots for less than $100 yes is a bargain.
customer_reviews.author: Jean-Francois P.

customer_reviews.title: Nice fit, comfortable, but dubious traction.
customer_reviews.text: I've been wearing slip and skid resistant shoes for nearly 20 years and the shoes I use for work have more grip. These are HORRIBLE on ice and poor in icy conditions. I've slipped more in these than my work shoes on the same environment. Though if you are just hiking, these are very comfortable. I do wear these in more pleasant weather as they are more comfortable than my work shoes. I'll offer these as average, given the reason I purchased them was specifically for icy conditions.
customer_reviews.author: William Santiago

customer_reviews.title: Well built! And, most  Comfortable !
customer_reviews.text: I just got them today. They did arrive early so I can try them out for the weekend. I have learned to invest a few more dollars for a well built shoe of any kind so they will be kind to my feet. These are a nice pair of snow boots and they are affordable. I expect they will be durable and suitable for snow shoeing. Hopeful they will meet my expectations. It is now late March. I have had a chance to test them out in snow, mud , ice, and am real happy with them. They are comfortable for longer hikes and plenty of traction and dry warmth.
customer_reviews.author: trigger

customer_reviews.title: These boots were sold as USED but in good shape for a price of 30% of its retail value.
customer_reviews.text: When received, these "used" Columbia insulated (to -32 degrees F) and waterproof boots came in original packaging without a flaw. Not a scratch ... not scrap ... not a defect. Like new! Thank you to those of you fellow buyers who took the time to rate these boots and their sizing. Having read your remarks that they run small, I ordered a full size up. I normally wear a size 10, so I ordered a size 11. Perfect. I regard myself as a knowledgeable consumer who does his research. I've had a wonderful experience shopping on Amazon and, believe that this was oe of those 7-star buys. Thank you Amazon. Thank you Columbia.
customer_reviews.author: Greg J. Schubert

customer_reviews.title: Happy Purchase
customer_reviews.text: I bought these boots and I do not regret spending a little more than what I originally intended to spend. These boots are well constructed and feel great, even though I didn't have a chance to break them in. I wore them on a weekend camping trip so far and they kept my feet warm and dry the entire time. I ordered a half size large based on other reviews and the recommendation was spot on. These boots are snug and supportive, without being to tight. I am really looking forward to using them again in the near future to test them some more. Bring on the snow.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase
customer_reviews.text: For some reason my normal boot size is smaller then my shoe size. I wear a 13 in any style of tenus/basketball shoe. However my book size in my danners are 11 1/2. Same with under amour boots. These bigots however are true to size. I bought a 12 but they were to small. I exchanged them for a 13 and they fit perfect. Very comfortable boot, water proof. Everything I was looking for. I use them for hunting and hiking in the PNW and have no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: David-2000

customer_reviews.title: PLEASE READ ME
customer_reviews.text: Trust me!! Go one size bigger!!!! First pair I got was too small so I sent it back and got one size bigger and everything fits now. Insulated part is ok. I had some cheap snow boots that were warmer than these. I don’t think they are completely water tight. I went through a mud hole full of water and my toes got a little cold. When I got home a few minutes later and took my boots off, I checked my socks and they felt a little damp. I still like them. I bought them to work in
customer_reviews.author: angela

customer_reviews.title: My advice order a full size larger then you normally wear, and allow time for breaking these in.
customer_reviews.text: Day one out of the box, I wear a size 10 5. 4E , I ordered a size 11 and could not wear these boots with even a thin sock on. After a mile and a half walk the boots did stretch so I can at least wear normal summer socks. The boots are still snug, I do have enough room in the toe area and my feet don't feel cramped so I don't believe it will make my gout flare up. I'll update this review after one week of wearing them while walking my dog.
customer_reviews.author: David White

customer_reviews.title: great sturdy boot runs small
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son who wears size 8-8.5 Nike, I bought this in a 9. It fits with just a little wiggle room. The boots are nice and strong around the ankle even before lacing up. I hate floppy boots that don't support the ankle for an active boy. This seem like good trail and snow boot. They are not too heavy but they are not what I would call light. He likes them.
customer_reviews.author: ang mora

customer_reviews.title: These boots would seem to do their job well in the snow!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased several pairs of winter boots VIA Amazon's Prime Wardrobe to take onto a trip up in the Swiss alps and I just chose to opt to go with a different pair of boots. There was nothing wrong with these, I just took other factors into consideration such as price, fit with my socks, and length of the boot up my leg. These boots I believe would have done their job as needed in the snow!
customer_reviews.author: MS

customer_reviews.title: Size up, or measure your foot before purchase
customer_reviews.text: Good thing I measured up the 26cm before purchase. This boot runs xsmall because of the extra inside padding. It is snug even as I sized up 2 sizes. I would guess whoever sized this boot was going by outside measure as opposed to inside thick padded measure. The boot is warm enough so far @ 7 degreesF, and light enough for a hike. However I have to agree, no quick lacing w/o the metal fast lace. These boots are total lace up, and would have been a deal breaker had I noticed before ordering.
customer_reviews.author: christo nomolas

customer_reviews.title: Not for those with high foot arches
customer_reviews.text: Would have loved to keep these boots as they appeared durable and well-made, however, there is a design flaw... The boot was designed to not allow movement in the lower tongue, so anyone with high foot arches may not be able to wear these! I had to return the boots, which was a bummer. Also, be forewarned, the boots are tall and super stiff...so would be good ankle support for those who need it, but the stiffness could irritate others.
customer_reviews.author: Salvador

customer_reviews.title: tennis shoe boot
customer_reviews.text: .This is my new favorite , great fit and a light as a feather . Super insulation The best part is the tread , Will be great for snow removal etc.
customer_reviews.author: scott colwes

customer_reviews.title: very warm boots...
customer_reviews.text: They are very warm on freezing cold days, nice and light weight, not you average heavy boot. It is very well made. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is that the bootliner has a rough area by his ankle and it gets sore. We tried super thick socks but then the foot part is to tight. He does love them, we ordered leg warmers to cover up and cushen just his ankles and that we think will do the trick. I got a different pair and I absolutly love them, I can be in the house in my slippers and pull them off and slip right into my boots and i'm ready to go.
customer_reviews.author: LAURIE M.

customer_reviews.title: 10.5 tennis  was equal to a 12 in these
customer_reviews.text: Got these for my teen son heading to college. The sizes are small so while he is a 10.5 to 11 in tennis shoes the 12 fit him perfectly. They look super nice and should serve him well in the rain and snow. Color of the boots and strings are perfect match for Texas Tech colors so that was a nice surprise. Awesome boots for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Get one full size bigger
customer_reviews.text: I usually wear size 8.5 and in some cases 9. In this boot I had to get size 9.5 and even that seems tight. Shoe feel very stiff when you first put them on. I wore them in house for few hours and they loosened up. Seems wider than standard boots but again it needs few hours of breaking in before you can enjoy them. My only concern is that my big toe nail hits the top of the boot (bridge area) so is a bit uncomfortable for me.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Kazi

customer_reviews.title: *****DO NOT BUY AS THESE BOOTS ARE NOT WIDE WIDTH!!*****
customer_reviews.text: It seems that the boots that were delivered were previously tried on by another customer as the laces were undone and uneven. Which means that someone else had returned these boots. I gave it a try and these boots are Way Too Small and Tight!! They sizing of the boot is NOT CORRECT for a Wide Width. It seems that Width Sizing is either Regular or Narrow Width. Amazon should report this DEFECT an egregious ERROR to Columbia.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: CHANGE THE INSOLES!
customer_reviews.text: A little tight but I figured it out. I normally wear a size 12 for everything. These boots were a little tight. Too tight if I wore wool socks. Until I noticed how thick the insole was. About 3/8th thick if not more. Removed the insole and replaced with insoles from my lightweight Columbia hikers and problem fixed. Now I can wear a good pair of wool socks and they fit perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Bushcraft Basics

customer_reviews.title: Sizing runs ~1/2 small...
customer_reviews.text: Requested two sizes of these boots to cross-check sizing using a medium-weight socks. For most boots a size 10.5 fits well but in these boots my big toe was crowded. Even the size 11 was a bit snug with the medium-weight socks. The boots were returned after the test fit (inside) but they appear to be a robust product keeping with the Columbia brand.
customer_reviews.author: Jim_Handy

customer_reviews.title: Great boots!!
customer_reviews.text: Im a woman size 9 bought a size 9 in mens. Didn't know they had a woman's version. They seem to fit ok. Snug. Roomy at the toes. My plan is to wear them with ski socks, so they may be just right. Our feet keep growing lol! 8.5 might have been better for me though.. these are great boots!!!! I must say, these are definitely keepers!
customer_reviews.author: tina smith

customer_reviews.title: Is size Wide still wide?!?
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, they're going back. Too snug on my toes even though I ordered 9W. I normally wear 8 or 8.5 W. I really liked the look of the boots, and the quality of the materials and construction appears quite good. I wore them in my house with thick winter socks for about an hour and a half and finally cried, "uncle!" They started feeling like my ski boots of past, uncomfortable, very cramped around the toes. Too many manufacturers of clothing and shoes today are sizing their products down. Not appreciated!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wear them often before you need them.
customer_reviews.text: Don't try to wear fat socks in this boot. Firstly, the boot doesn't require additional insulation- it's great. Secondly, the boot will fit tighter where you don't want it to. You HAVE TO wear the boot in advance of your 'event' so you can break in...wait for it....the tongue so it molds to your foot. You will never have cold feet in these boots. Ever.
customer_reviews.author: animal supporter

customer_reviews.title: These boots are awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Listen, the great thing about these boots via Amazon is that I found these on two other sites and Amazon had these for the same price or cheaper...then you add in my Amazon prime for "free" shipping it's a win win. The boots themselves are high quality, feel good and keep your feet warm and surprisingly not too sweaty. I love the Columbia brand and love these boots. Gents buy these asap!!!
customer_reviews.author: Vincent Ray

customer_reviews.title: Great boots!
customer_reviews.text: These boots are great but as other reviews have stated, they run small. Knowing this, I went a full size up for my son and they are perfect. They also seem fairly narrow so it may not work for someone with wide feet. I usually try to go even larger to try and get 2 snow seasons out of them but I doubt they will fit next year. Luckily, I have 2 younger boys that can wear them later on!
customer_reviews.author: Will Knapik

customer_reviews.title: Very nice boots, high quality and perfect fit/performance
customer_reviews.text: Excellent boots. Brought them for cold and rainy weather I have been using it and comfort is superior and pretty well insulated. Strongly recommended for cold wheatelher and general walking either urban or countryside. Excellent design also from Columbia.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Columbia Baguboot
customer_reviews.text: I am liking this boot so far. I normally wear a size 9 regular. I followed the suggestions of going up one size, so I ordered a size 10. They fit comfortably. If you would like to wear a pair of heavy socks, I suggest going up one and a half size. For instance for me 10 1/2. This pair fits me perfect. I hope this helps everyone when ordering.
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: Great boots!
customer_reviews.text: I saw a bunch of reviews for these boots stating that they are too tight, but I would disagree. I am very glad that I stuck with my normal size for these and did not try to buy a size larger. I will admit that the first fitment felt tight and had me a little nervous. After a couple times shoveling however, the insulation had broken in a little bit and they fit perfect. Kept my feet warm and completely dry in some pretty nasty conditions. Very happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: Josh C.

customer_reviews.title: Ideal fit and perfect for Buffalo snow
customer_reviews.text: The boots were shipped fast. I broke them in going to a client construction site. They are very lightweight, fit me perfectly, and they are very comfortable, and lightweight. I did not test their waterproof abilities yet, but I can assume there is zero issues there. I will provide an update once I thoroughly test that out with these boots. These are a very good quality and you cannot go wrong with Columbia products.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Rayner

customer_reviews.title: Great support
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my first snow shoeing trip and loved everything about them. I wear a 10.5 usually and so I purchased the same size. I was worried that with wool socks they would be too small and while it was snug they really felt great on a 4 mile snow shoe hike. I really liked the lacing system as it was very easy to lace them and get everything right. After wearing them for 4 hours during the hike and then another 1.5 hours afterwards when I removed them my socks were dry as could be.
customer_reviews.author: Jeromy L

customer_reviews.title: Columbia's Definition of WIDE is Narrow
customer_reviews.text: Fine boot, waterproof and lengthwise sized appropriately. I purchase wide shoes from Nike, New Balance, and Sketchers without issue, but these wide boots are anything but. I had to wear them for two weeks for them to be wearable, and even then, they aren't all day boots. Winter will be over soon and I wont have to worry about it, but they should really widen up.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Binder

customer_reviews.title: Nice but buy a size bigger
customer_reviews.text: Great boot perfect for what I needed. A snow boot that can handle hiking in the snow. It runs 1 size too small. I listen to the other reviews and bought 1 size bigger and it fit great.
customer_reviews.author: kelly keelty

customer_reviews.title: Insole doesn’t come out
customer_reviews.text: I would have preferred a removable insole as I have an orthotic I would like to use. While it is not thick and I did order one size larger adding the orthotic made the boot tight. Have not worn much yet so we’ll see. Bought for hunting in October and November; currently weather too warm. I have not had much luck with Columbia boots like these being waterproof but buy for the fit. I need a flexible and wide toe box due to foot issues. And they are are good as I have come up with. Ask me in December how they worked out.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Light and comfy
customer_reviews.text: Easy to get on and off. Order at least 1 1/2 sizes larger than your regular shoes. I wear a 9 1/2 W and the 11W fits perfect. Seem to be warm enough all though it hasn’t been below zero yet. Laces are too short. It would be nice if the top two eyelets were speed laces. Thay are very light weight which I really like.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Good boots and value for money
customer_reviews.text: Finally got to wear them in my trip to ski mountains with lots of snow. It takes a bit of effort to put them on. Thereafter they are comfortable to walk around. Don’t expect gliding but good for snow and slippery conditions. I still had to put on warm socks as my feet were cold with regular socks in 23 degree F.
customer_reviews.author: Ash

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality/Too Small
customer_reviews.text: I usually don't write reviews, but I want to help out the men who are ordering these boots. All of the shoes I own are size 14 Wide, I ordered these boots in size 15 Wide and they're too small. I returned the boots and ordered size 16 Wide. I had to go up 2 sizes to be able to wear these boots with thicker socks. The boots appear to be made well, but the sizing on them runs really small.
customer_reviews.author: BP

customer_reviews.title: The insulation padding makes the boot tighter and seem smaller
customer_reviews.text: My shoe size is a 9 usually but this boot I order in a 9. It was to small on my feet due to the padding in the boot that’s for the warmth part and the insole is 1/4 inch thick which made it even tighter I tried taking them out. They fit better then but still just little to tight and on smaller size. But as far the the keeping ur feet warm I really think they will my feet got warm within minutes on having it on
customer_reviews.author: jody mullis

customer_reviews.title: High quality boot and good value, but without wider width sizes
customer_reviews.text: This is a super quality boot, but coming only in whole sizes and without wider widths than a regular-D, it will be tight for folks with E width feet, and too tight for EE widths when wearing hiking or winter socks. I had to return the pair I bought because of that, but am very much impressed with the quality of finish on these boots.
customer_reviews.author: CrusaderRabbit50

customer_reviews.title: Loved it!
customer_reviews.text: Waited a while for it to go on sale but they ranout of my size. I ordered 8.5, my regular size but maybe because of its think insulation i settled on 9.5. Bit of hassle but satisfied with final product. You dont even need socks with it
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Another NON-waterproof, waterproof boot from Columbia
customer_reviews.text: This is the second style of Columbia boots I've purchased that was supposed to be waterproof. Guess what... they're NOT waterproof. EVERY TIME I've worn these in the snow my feet end up wet. Junk is what they are. Columbia used to make quality stuff but they won't get another dime from me.
customer_reviews.author: D. Houser

customer_reviews.title: Good looking and a bit snug
customer_reviews.text: The boots look and feel( a little tight for a 13) good. They are well insulated which could account for the snugness. I like the way they feel and the tread seems aggressive....which is good in the snow. I’d buy again just get a half size larger.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Wood

customer_reviews.title: Awesome snow boots
customer_reviews.text: I bought these before going on our trip to Durango/Purgatory, CO. They were a little snug at first but got better..I normally wear a 10.5 but went up to an 11 because of other reviews I read. Go up one full size to be safe. I walked in more than a foot of snow, ice cold water (submerged) and rode a snowmobile for hours and my feet stayed super warm and dry. They are very comfortable and aren't too bulky like many of the other snow boots. I am more than pleased with these boots.
customer_reviews.author: Todd

customer_reviews.title: Runs very small
customer_reviews.text: My son wears a 10 in adidas. We ordered these in a 10.5 and they were much too small. The shoes look great, seem warm and sturdy but they really should fix their sizing. There’s no reason to be so very small and make people have to return and guess what size might fit.
customer_reviews.author: Rosalia’s Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Strength
customer_reviews.text: The first thing that struck me with these boots on was how strong the boot felt on my leg. This boot gives a great feeling of support around my leg. I tried 3 brands before settling on Columbia. I think I've got myself a great choice.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Hunsucker

customer_reviews.title: Very Narrow and short fit but good quality
customer_reviews.text: The boots arrived quickly. They look to be very good quality and warm construction. However, the fit is very narrow and short. I usually wear a size 10/10.5 med width boot. My last pair that are about 10 years old finally fell apart around all the seams , they were a size 11. This size 11 was extremely narrow and a little short, so I am reordering in an 11.5 wide. Lets hope the wider and .5 size even larger will fit like my old Bugaboos.
customer_reviews.author: D. Crandell

customer_reviews.title: Winter armor for your feet
customer_reviews.text: A much have item in your wardrobe if you live in a place like Upper Michigan. They are hard on the outside and heavy, but your feet will be safe and warm in these. Little costly? But you don't have to worry about snow boots for at least next 4-5 years. They have a nice grip at the bottom so you won't slip easily. I don't know how waterproof they are but my feet never got wet even by stepping into puddles many times.
customer_reviews.author: Abhishek Wadaskar

customer_reviews.title: Nice boots
customer_reviews.text: Nice boots. However, I usually wear 10.5 or 11. I've returned two pair, now ordering size 12, should fit properly.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Martin

customer_reviews.title: Runs small, adequate for heat...not great
customer_reviews.text: Not the greatest boot. It's ok. The fit is a little small. I usually wear a 10.5 and purchased an 11. I would have returned for a larger size but my kid can wear it for this year. They are not very warm either. My kid is ok because he is running up and down hills sledding but if he stands for very long his feet get cold.
customer_reviews.author: Don Peck

customer_reviews.title: Size Up!
customer_reviews.text: Based on previous reviews, we went up 2 sizes and they fit perfectly. They're durable, warm, rugged and well insulated against moisture. The traction is great and the overall construction is rock solid. Overall, size up and you'll be extremely happy.
customer_reviews.author: E. Ronakov

customer_reviews.title: High Quality from sole to stitching
customer_reviews.text: These boots can easily go for more money. I should have gotten the wider version because these choked my right foot for a whole day. eventually, you will break them in and they will fit perfectly true to size. Hiked Giant Ledge Mountain upstate in the rain and icy conditions. submerged these boys in mud deep water and are truly sealed and waterproof. the sole pattern grips incredibly well and a slight heel prepares you for each unleveled step you take during a trek.
customer_reviews.author: Dan vega

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: I don't have a huge for by any means, but I purchased the regular width boot and it killed my feet. I purchased these wide boots instead, and they are fantastic. Very comfortable, warm, dry, and great grip. I would recommend getting a size larger than normal, as they run a bit small and if you're like me, you'll be wearing a thicker sock while using this boot in the cold.
customer_reviews.author: Garrett

customer_reviews.title: Snug fit but should do the trick
customer_reviews.text: All my shoes I have are 10.5 so I naturally went with this size when I ordered and after reading some reviews. These are a very snug fit and feel well made. If I were to wear a thick insulated sock I would have to upsize. Since I'm not on any winter expedition these should work out fine for normal winter use with a typical sock thickness. Note: these will make you taller from the sole thickness so when driving you may have to make some adjustments to the seat and steering wheel. Just getting in and out of the vehicle was awkward at first. Satisfied with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Cascio

customer_reviews.title: Nice boot but sizing is off & isn't a quick lace boot for sure
customer_reviews.text: Warm waterproof boot that runs almost a whole size smaller. The lacing of the boots make them difficult to untie & get off very fast. The rubber portion is hard to break in - so tends to leave you with sore feet after a few hours of wearing them for chores.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tight fitting but I fixed that
customer_reviews.text: Straight to the point. They are tight even the wide ones. What I did was I took the insole out so I could get my foot into the boot. I wore them for a few weeks to break them in then put the insole back in the boot and they are as comfortable as can be. My last set lasted through seven winters!!
customer_reviews.author: S. Adams

customer_reviews.title: Small and tight.
customer_reviews.text: Bought one size larger than my needs and still had trouble with these. They felt of high quality and very warm at first but they were so tight they were restricting blood flow which... made my feet feel cold. Not a great start for a "winter" boot.
customer_reviews.author: BradFoxUS

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, warm and grippy!!
customer_reviews.text: Definitely much smaller than billed, both length and width. When you get a size that fits they're pretty good. Easy to lace up tight, no leg abrasion, great grip on snow and ice. It's only January, let's see how they do in February and March!!!
customer_reviews.author: NorthEndBoston

customer_reviews.title: Great boots, but order 2 sizes up!
customer_reviews.text: After reading the other reviews saying these ran small, I bought a size 12 Wide (I normally wear a size 11 Wide) which ALMOST fit, but not quite, so I returned and bought a 13 W. These fit MUCH better. Boots are comfortable (as much as very high top boots can be "comfortable") and warm. They seem durable and pretty waterproof as well, but no experience with that yet.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Runs small and narrow.  Rigid fit
customer_reviews.text: They looked great- I’m a size 13, ordered a 13 and my toe was squished at the end. So Inhad to return them. The back seemed really stiff as well and the feel inside was very narrow. Quality sole and exterior though
customer_reviews.author: FarmerJ

customer_reviews.title: Durable and comfy
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my husband, he is really tough on his boots. They have to bend without pain and be durable, he's a tile Mason. Also they are really warm and comfortable. He's hard to please about his boots but seems to love these.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Dono

customer_reviews.title: Great Boots
customer_reviews.text: Great boots and exactly what I wanted for the Michigan winter. I would suggest that you order a larger size than you normally take. I actually ended up taking 1 and 1/2 sizes larger than I normally do. This also helps if you wear thicker socks. Love Em.
customer_reviews.author: Tracey Spiller

customer_reviews.title: Good, warm,  boot
customer_reviews.text: good boots, keeps feet warm without thick wool socks. But they run small ..about 1 size small. I am a 12-12.5. The 13's are little snug with regular socks. If I needed to wear thick wool socks for extreme cold, I would not be able to wear these. I tried a pair of 14's on at a sports equipment store and they were too big, so I kept the 13's .
customer_reviews.author: PA_Robert

customer_reviews.title: Columbia quality is decending like a rock
customer_reviews.text: This Bugaboo boot just a few years ago was of better quality when, ironically made in Taiwan. Since they are now made in Vietnam, everything is cheaper. Metal eyelets are just nylon straps, insoles are paper thin and oh yeah, leaks at the top of your foot. The previous size doesn't match anymore either. Choose at least a size larger now.
customer_reviews.author: sp

customer_reviews.title: Two strikes and you’re out!!
customer_reviews.text: After reading reviews I ordered 1/2 size larger. Too small. Returned and ordered full size larger and WIDE. STILL TOO SMALL AND NARROW
customer_reviews.author: Martin Loof

customer_reviews.title: Buy one size up. Great boots
customer_reviews.text: Great boots, just buy a size up from what you normally wear. They run small. Based on previous reviews I bought a size 10, normally he wears a 9 and they fit great. The 9 would have been to small. Keep feet warm and dry
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Not warm!
customer_reviews.text: This boots did not keep my feet warm. I wore good wool socks and at 4F my toes froze after 10 mins. The -30F rating is meaningless.
customer_reviews.author: F. Aldrich

customer_reviews.title: good boots
customer_reviews.text: these boots fit properly I always wear size 12 got these in 12 and they fit perfectly these boots are not designed to be worn with heavy bulky socks they are insulated to keep you warm down to -25%F use a normal cotton sock and your fine
customer_reviews.author: BA

customer_reviews.title: Super Warm But Sizing is Off
customer_reviews.text: I tried these on at DSW before ordering them. I usually wear a size 9 or 9.5. I had to order a size 10 and sometimes after a long day, I think that these boots may be still a little too small. Other than that, your toes won't freeze at all or even get wet as you tread through the snow.
customer_reviews.author: bstndance

customer_reviews.title: Sizing is out of whack
customer_reviews.text: Something went wrong with your sizing when you moved your manufacturing from China to Vietnam. I've purchased a 10.5 or 11 (US) for decades. Now I can't even get my foot into an 11 wide. Please fix this because nothing beats Columbia shoes and boots.
customer_reviews.author: Salvatore A.

customer_reviews.title: Way too small
customer_reviews.text: I normally wear an 8 to 8.5 shoe. I ordered a 9 and it was too small. Then I ordered a 9.5 and still too small.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Twain

customer_reviews.title: fantastic boot but the sizing makes zero sense.
customer_reviews.text: I wear a size 10 1/2. That boot was insanely small for that size. I returned and got an 11 and its still too small. i dunno where the sizing comes from but its not accurate. get one full size up or its going to be way too tight.
customer_reviews.author: S.Lux

customer_reviews.title: Runs a size too small but amazing product highly recommend it
customer_reviews.text: These run a little bit small. So get a half to a size bigger. It’s a thick sturdy good boot. In my personal opinion it is worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Gigi

customer_reviews.title: Order a bit larger size
customer_reviews.text: Sizing is smaller than usual. Order at least a half-size larger than you wear normally. I was surprised how lightweight they are, but they are as well designed and well made as you would expect from Columbia. Very good boots, but be careful to order a larger size.
customer_reviews.author: N. E. Body

customer_reviews.title: I needed boots but no time to shop
customer_reviews.text: These boots are great. Very warm and waterproof- which is why I needed them for the weather in Maine. Great price, they do run small so I had to return them and order a larger size. All of which was a fairly seamless process.
customer_reviews.author: Music Maineiac

customer_reviews.title: Large sizes
customer_reviews.text: Hard to find a size 17 boot (or shoe) that doesn't feel like you're wearing a boat on your feet. These are great. Will definitely look to buy again after I wear these out.
customer_reviews.author: CraigG

customer_reviews.title: Way too small, otherwise I’m sure they would be fine.
customer_reviews.text: I wear a 10 in every brand of shoe, boot, ski boot, etc. Except, apparently, these boots. They were way too small, perhaps even 2 sizes too small. Otherwise, they’re probably great boots.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Muse

customer_reviews.title: good value for a hiking boot
customer_reviews.text: I`ve been wearing these boots mainly for work and just general pavement pounding,pretty comfortable and light weight they are reasonably waterproof and grippy in the wet and snow as well. the biggest problem is their longevity, the soles wear pretty quickly and I have been buying a new pair every year , but the price is right and Amazon Prime gets them to my door just in time !
customer_reviews.author: DesmoJim

customer_reviews.title: Great warm boots
customer_reviews.text: I like the fit and warmth of these boots, they are light and easy to walk in. I use them for work, I carry mail and walk 8.5 miles a day. I have not complaints about them
customer_reviews.author: Becky

customer_reviews.title: Best boots ive owned
customer_reviews.text: First day the boots fit a little snug, but after wearing them for 3days they are fitting perfect with normal half calf socks. Can't wait to try these in the snow so far in the cold rain my feet stayed really warm and dry. Order a half size bigger, a good amount of padding is inside
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Litchfield

customer_reviews.title: Leaks water
customer_reviews.text: I've had several pairs of these boots. They all leak water into them, mostly from the toe area. Its not leaking from Standing in water, but light rain, walking through wet grass, in snow or even just on a road after it rains. It's the only downside. It seems a design issue as 3-4 pairs have had this issue over 8-10 years. Otherwise a great boot.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Way off size, very stiff, even if they weren’t 2 sizes off you’re gonna walk like an idiot in them
customer_reviews.text: WAY TOO SMALL, crazy stiff like ski boots and clompy, about 10 laps around the house in and out and I put em straight back in the box. They were about a full Imperial size and at least 3 UK off.
customer_reviews.author: Sharlene M. Mccoy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality
customer_reviews.text: These boots are perfect. I bought them to go to Colorado and they were worth it. just get them .5 bigger than your actual size.
customer_reviews.author: suleisi perez

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, be aware boots are very big
customer_reviews.text: I bought the boots for normal use (not snow) and I realized that are quite big, but is probably the way this kind of boots are (my bad), so be aware that this boots are not exactly a shoes to look good
customer_reviews.author: Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Good, quality boots
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my husband before we left for a trip. He was very impressed with the quality of the boots. He also loved that it helped him stay warm and dry during our son’s pond hockey tournament. Good quality for a decent price considering he uses it occasionally during travel and the once a year it snows here in Atlanta.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Fan

customer_reviews.title: perfect fit (wide version) but too heavy and ugly
customer_reviews.text: I suppose for a winter shoe its not ridiculous, but its quite a heavy and inflexible boot -- it would be hard to walk in, in my opinion. Its also not a very trendy look. Lots of plastic.
customer_reviews.author: nobody

customer_reviews.title: Snow Camp Winter Retreat
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for our teenage son as he headed off to a winter snow retreat. He said his feet were always comfortable & dry. He did a great deal of walking, running, & different activities. I was expecting to pay close to $100 for quality boots. Finding them in a size 14 that looked nice was great!
customer_reviews.author: Dawn Deshetsky

product_meta.title: Columbia Men's Bugaboot Iii Mid Calf Boot
product_meta.description:
Whether you’re a serious outdoorsman or just looking for a dependable pair of winter boots, Columbia offers a reliable and durable solution. The Columbia Men’s Bugaboot Plus III is a comfortable and classic military-style boot that is designed for longevity and made from superior materials. These tactical boots have been engineered to hold up against cold weather, snow, and wet conditions while keeping your feet comfortable and warm. These super-warm boots feature 200g insulation and thermal-reflective liners and are rated at -25F/-32C.

Columbia boots are well-known for their superior construction and high-quality materials. These men’s outdoor boots are made from a combination of leather, nylon, webbing, and metal hardware. They are waterproof, seam-sealed, and designed via the infused reflective and other technologies to protect your feet from exposure to the cold. You can use these military boots for men on several surfaces without compromising comfort. The superior cushioning built into these men’s outdoor boots permits maximum impact absorption with a high energy return. The advanced traction outsole is designed to grip onto every environment and surface type.

We offer the Columbia Men’s Bugaboot Plus III boots in multiple sizes on Amazon.com. To ensure that you receive the perfect size, follow these steps for proper measurement. Use a material measuring tape and fold it up at the dotted line. Place the heel against a wall or other 90-degree surface and place your foot on a piece of paper or cardboard. Mark the end of the longest toe with a pen or pencil. Measure both feet and use the larger measurement. Compare the measurement to our size chart, finding the closest larger measurement and using that number to determine your shoe size for your country’s shoe measurement standards.
feature_bullets: COMFORTABLE MILITARY-STYLE BOOTS: The Columbia Men’s Bugaboot Plus III is a classic and comfortable military-style boot made from superior materials and designed for longevity, comfort, and warmth.

SUPERIOR MATERIALS: To withstand constant use outdoors in cold weather, our boots consist of 100% leather, nylon, webbing, and metal hardware. The shaft of these imported boots measures 8.5” from arch and the platform measures .75 inches.
Outer Material: Omni-Heat 200g insulated fabric lining

EXCEPTIONAL TRACTION ON MULTIPLE SURFACES: Whether you’re a climber, an outdoor enthusiast, or simply looking for dependable tactical boots for men, you’ll discover superior traction thanks to our non-marking rubber sole.

KEEPS YOU WARM IN COLD WEATHER: Our dedication to superior craftsmanship ensures that your feet stay warm in cold weather climates. These super-warm boots feature 200g insulation and thermal-reflective liners rated at -32 degrees.

OMNI-GRIP: This multi-terrain traction system matches specially formulated compounds and treads to specific environments. A dual-zone winter tread pattern ensures solid footing on surfaces such as ice and snow, providing grip for every environment.
